SEARCH
Package edu.newsbot

Class ParsingSendingScheduler

java.lang.Object
edu.newsbot.ParsingSendingScheduler
public class ParsingSendingScheduler extends Object
The ParsingSendingScheduler class is responsible for scheduling and managing tasks that involve parsing web pages for news links and sending extracted information to users. It uses a ScheduledExecutorService to handle task scheduling in a thread-safe manner, ensuring that tasks are executed at specified delays.

This class maintains a map of user tasks to prevent duplicate scheduling for the same user. When a new task is scheduled for a user, any existing task for that user is first cancelled. This ensures that each user has at most one active task, preventing overlapping executions and potential data inconsistencies.

  • Constructor Details

    • ParsingSendingScheduler

      public ParsingSendingScheduler()

  • Method Details

    • scheduleLinkParsing

      public static void scheduleLinkParsing(String link, long delay, TimeUnit unit, long userId)
      Schedules a new task for parsing a link and sending messages to the user at fixed delays. If a task is already scheduled for the user, it will be stopped before scheduling/rescheduling a new one.
      Parameters:
      link - The link of primary page (the page-list of title-links to news; example: https://www.sciencedaily.com/news/earth_climate/climate/) to be parsed.
      delay - The delay between consecutive executions of the task.
      unit - The time unit of the delay.
      userId - The telegram user ID of the user for whom the task is scheduled.

    • stopUserTask

      public static void stopUserTask(long userId)
      Stops the task associated with the specified user ID, if it is currently active.
      Parameters:
      userId - The telegram user ID of the user whose task is to be stopped.

    • stopAll

      public static void stopAll()
      Stops all scheduled tasks and shuts down the scheduler. This method is intended to be called during application shutdown to ensure proper resource management.
